page_summaries.content:
1.1.  General description
LED driver consisting of resistor-equipped NPN transistor with two diodes on one chip in a leadless medium power DFN2020D-6 (SOT1118D) Surface-Mounted Device (SMD) plastic package with visible and solderable side pads.

1.2.  Features and benefits
• Stabilized output current of 10 mA without external resistor
• Stabilized output current adjustable up to 150 mA when an external resistor is used
• High current accuracy at supply voltage variation
• Low voltage overhead of 1.4 V
• Reduces component count and board space
• High power dissipation of 530 mW
• Supply voltage up to 40 V
• Digital PWM input up to 10 kHz frequency for NCR421PAS
• AEC-Q101 qualified

1.3.  Applications
• Constant current LED driver
• Generic constant current source
• Automotive applications (for example: interior lighting, dash board, instrumentation, number plate light)
• Increase stabilized output current by paralleling drivers

Product Summary.content: LED driver consisting of resistor-equipped NPN transistor with two diodes on one chip in a leadless medium power DFN2020D-6 (SOT1118D) Surface-Mounted Device (SMD) plastic package with visible and solderable side pads. It features a stabilized output current of 10 mA without external resistor, adjustable up to 150 mA with an external resistor, high current accuracy at supply voltage variation, low voltage overhead of 1.4 V, and reduces component count and board space.

The LED driver has a high power dissipation of 530 mW, supply voltage up to 40 V, digital PWM input up to 10 kHz frequency for NCR421PAS model, and is AEC-Q101 qualified. It is suitable for constant current LED driver applications, generic constant current source, automotive applications such as interior lighting, dash board, instrumentation, number plate light, and can increase stabilized output current by paralleling drivers.

The product overview includes general description, key features and benefits, and applications. It covers details such as package type, output current characteristics, voltage specifications, power dissipation, input signal support, qualification, and potential use cases.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 2 provides quick reference data for key electrical parameters such as enable voltage (VEN), output voltage (Vout), and stabilized output current (Iout) for the NCR420PAS and NCR421PAS devices under typical operating conditions. It specifies the minimum, typical, and maximum values for these parameters.

Table 6 lists the limiting values or absolute maximum ratings for electrical parameters like stabilized output current (Iout), enable voltage (VEN), output voltage (Vout), reverse voltage (VR), total power dissipation (Ptot), junction temperature (Tj), ambient temperature (Tamb), and storage temperature (Tstg). These ratings must not be exceeded to ensure reliable operation and prevent permanent damage to the devices.

Table 8 provides detailed electrical characteristics of the devices, including collector-emitter breakdown voltage (V(BR)CEO), DC current gain (hFE), internal resistor (Rint), voltage drop across internal resistor (VRint), enable current (IEN), bias resistor (RB), stabilized output current (Iout) under different conditions, minimum output voltage (Vout,min), output current change over temperature (ΔIout/(Iout x ΔTamb)) and supply voltage (ΔIout/(Iout x ΔVCC)). These characteristics are specified at an ambient temperature of 25°C unless otherwise noted.

The text also mentions several figures (Fig. 18 to Fig. 25) that provide graphical representations of the output current as a function of output voltage, enable voltage, and enable current for the NCR421PAS device under typical conditions. These figures can be useful for understanding the device's behavior and performance over a range of operating conditions.

To safely drive currents that are above the limits of the NCR42xPAS, two or more devices can be parallel connected as illustrated in Figure 28. When choosing the same values for the external resistors, the drive current splits equally and the capability of handling excess power is doubled.
Both, NCR420PAS and NCR421PAS can be used in this parallel configuration to drive higher currents safely.

Mechanical Characteristics.content: Table 6 provides limiting values for various parameters of the electronic component in accordance with the Absolute Maximum Rating System (IEC 60134). It includes maximum values for stabilized output current (Iout), enable voltage (VEN), output voltage (Vout), reverse voltage (VR), total power dissipation (Ptot), junction temperature (Tj), ambient temperature (Tamb), and storage temperature (Tstg).

The maximum total power dissipation (Ptot) varies depending on the ambient temperature (Tamb) and the mounting configuration of the device on the Printed-Circuit Board (PCB). Different values are provided for devices mounted on FR4 PCBs with single-side copper or 4-layer copper, and with different mounting pad sizes for the collector.

The table also includes footnotes providing additional information and conditions for certain parameters, such as the reverse voltage (VR) being applicable between all terminals, and the specific mounting configurations for the different total power dissipation (Ptot) values.

The table includes footnotes that provide additional details on the conditions for the specified limits, such as the type of printed circuit board (PCB) used for mounting the device and the size of the mounting pad for the collector.

The text also mentions the package type for the component, which is DFN2020D-6: a plastic, thermally enhanced ultra thin and small outline package with no leads, 6 terminals, and a body size of 2 x 2 x 0.65 mm. The package code is SOT1118D.
